sourceDesc:
<<<<<<< HEAD
Iob expounded by Theodore Beza, partly in manner of a commentary, partly in manner of a paraphrase. Faithfully translated out of Latine into English Jobus. English Bèze, Théodore de, 1519-1605.
[436] p.
Printed by Iohn Legatt, printer to the Vniversitie of Cambridge. And are to be sold [by Abraham Kitson] at the signe of the Sunne in Paules Churchyard in London, [London] : [1589?]
Bookseller's name supplied and publication date conjectured by STC. Signatures: A-Z 2A² ; ² A-D. "Ecclesiastes, or the preacher" has separate title page and register. With the Bible text in English from Bèze's Latin translation. Part 2 identified as STC 2764 on UMI microfilm reel 275. Reproductions of the original in the Henry E. Huntington Library and Art Gallery. Appears at reel 275 and 279 (same copy filmed twice).
=======
